lead_paragraph: WADA--Takako "Taxie" Kusunoki, 94, passed away on January 22, 2016. Born in Colusa, California, Takako was incarcerated with her mother and two sisters at the Granada Relocation Center ("Camp Amache") in Colorado in 1942. After two years in the Women's Army Corps, she worked as a journalist, studied painting in the studio of Fernand Leger in Paris on the G.I. Bill of Rights, and served as the English-language editor of The New York Nichibei, a Japanese- American newspaper, becoming an important figure in the Asian-American civil rights movement. She also worked at JASSI (Japanese American Social Services). She is survived by Stephanie and Jennifer--her daughters with late husband Steve Wada--and by grandchildren Esther and Christopher. Mom, Grandma, we love and miss you. A memorial will be held at the Japanese American United Church, 255 Seventh Avenue, NYC, on March 5 at 2:00pm. 1/3
